title: Open some special PDF-Files in FF with a non-standard program
content:
My FF is set so that PDF files are downloaded automatically. In principle, this should remain that way. Now, however, I would like a few PDF files from my own disk to be opened directly instead. I have thought up a workaround for this - which unfortunately (STILL?) doesn't work properly:

1) The files in question (so far only one, as a test) are renamed *.PXX. 2) In Win I have defined that these *.PXX files should NOT be opened with my generally used PDF programme, but with Adobe Acrobat. This WORKS. 3) Now I had to define in FF that PXX should be treated differently from PDF. I haven't managed to do that yet - the files are still written to the download folder - RENAMED *.PDF 4) Meanwhile I found some (as far as I know) "unused" extensions in FF, amog them *.IRC. So, I renamed my *.PXX-file *.IRC and defined in FF that *.IRC-files should be opend by Adobe Acrobat. 5) NEVERTHELESS - disregarding this definition - the *.IRC-files are NOT opened but "downloaded" to the download-folder AND renamed *.PDF

Does anyone haven an idea?

creator: oldgreyguy1

title: Firefox Blocking Allowed Pop-Ups After Update
content: We run Firefox on all our clerk computers at the public library where I work. Since the most recent update, our online circulation website which we use to check out books, receives a pop-up blocked message every time we try to print a hold receipt for an item. The website has always been added as an exception to our pop-up blockers, and until just after the most recent update, the blocker had no problem allowing the website through. Now it does. I have tried clearing the browser caches, removing and adding the website to the exceptions list again, and restarting the browser, as well as adding different variations of the website to the exceptions list. In the end, we just had to turn the pop-up blockers off. I searched online for anyone else who had this issue, but the ones I found dated back to 2014-2015, and the solution they came up with no longer seems to exist in the Firefox settings. So I'm hoping to find an answer here! Thanks.

title: Firefox recently started to constantly freeze
content: Starting about a week ago, Firefox has had periods where it would freeze for about 5 seconds, followed by working normally for about 10 seconds. It happens when I'm scrolling, typing, or even sometimes when I'm doing nothing at all on a page. This also happens whether or not I have other programs open that could be slowing things down. According to task manager, I have plenty of spare CPU and RAM when it happens. I've tried turning off hardware acceleration, recreating the places file, and checking session restore as per this help article. It has also happened after restarting Firefox, so it shouldn't be a problem with that.

title: Cannot access or display my own domain website in Firefox
content:
I hope someone can help me with this problem. I own the domain "cpaaffiliatesnetwork.com" and the site serves as my business site and access to my business network platform. The site is SSL secured and the SSL certificate was renewed in February 2021 for 1 year. Since the SSL renewal, I started having issues accessing the site from any browsers installed on this computer (Edge, Firefox & Chrome). I have now managed to fix the display issue in both Edge & Chrome through clearing cache / history, BUT, I have tried the same with FF with no success. I have also tried uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox, but, still receive the error below for any attempt to access the site: Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.cpaaffiliatesnetwork.com. Peer’s Certificate has been revoked.

Error code: SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

All external people i have asked to check the site have confirmed it works fine for them, but, it will not work for me. Hoping someone has a suggestion many thanks in advance :)

title: Firefox debian - server not found only for some addresses but ok with other browsers
content:
Hi all,

Machine under debian testing, updated today.

I have a strange behavior from my firefox, some websites, and only a few, can't load correctly. IE with linkedin, the page is displayed without CSS and almost no content. In the firefox console I have 

   Loading failed for the <script> with source “https://static-exp1.licdn.com/sc/h/bpob6bbc8gauqn4cct96xaqpf”. www.linkedin.com:1932:1    Loading failed for the <script> with source “https://static-exp1.licdn.com/sc/h/efncoxjdl37tofw662sg013tp”.

And the fact, when I try loading one of those addresses, I have a "Server not found".

Everything is working fine under chrome or even Tor (which is in the end a modified firefox). 

   dig static-exp1.licdn.com

is returning correct entries my DNS configuration is correct (tried with multiple servers) I have nothing in my host file and no firewall/security rules/softwares in place

This problem occurs with firefox ESR installed from debian repositories and firefox downloaded from mozilla website. No add-ons installed.

I already tried removing my whole firefox config/profile and fresh reinstall without any add-ons

Tried also to disable DNS prefetch and IPV6 in firefox config.

Timezone date/time is configured correctly and sync with NTP

Thanks if you have any tips to sort this out.


EDIT 1: When activating DNS over HTTPS in config, everything works fine then. But then why this behavior only with a few addresses?

title: Configfile for Socks Host
content:
Hello,

I'm running Firefox ESR 78.9.0 and using the mozilla configfile and GPO. We're using Webmarshal and needed to import for all of our user the SSL certificate.

I succeeded and firefox now sees this certificate under the certificates, but firefox does not read it. For example, we have a block on facebook.com, but we can still access it, even though the certificate is in it.

I found out that if I manually enter the socks host with ipaddress, my sites will be blocked, but I can't manage to put this in the config file.

What I added: lockPref("network.proxy.socks", "servername.domain.nl"); lockPref("network.proxy.socks_port", 1234);

But when I open firefox, it cannot read the confile file with these 2 prefs. I would like some support so that these sites are also blocked on firefox. They are now only blocked on Internet Explorer and Google Chrome.

Thanks!

title: Firfox crashes when I start it.
content:
I tried my hardest to find what exactly is happening with Firefox, but have not found anything similar to my situation. When I try to open Firefox, it will pop up for a millisecond, then nothing happens. If I'm lucky, I might see a window open then immediately close. There is no error message or any sort of reason as to why this may be happening. This started when I tried to install this thing called Lively Wallpaper, here's the website: https://rocksdanister.github.io/lively/ Once I opened the file, Firefox closed and the problem started, I'm not certain if this thing is some sort of virus, but I don't believe it is.

When looking for a solution, I found something about changing my profile. However, I am unable to open the profile manager when I use the run dialogue box. The same thing happens: It will pop up for a millisecond, then close immediately. I don't think this is an issue of I'm not using the correct version of Firefox. I have been using the default version that Firefox leads me to for over a year, and have had no issues until now.

title: Firefox Don't Start
content:
Hello!

My Firefox stopped working this evening and I can't figure out why. When I open it, it shows a tiny, blank window for a fraction of a second and does nothing. I did some digging and this is what I found.

- Firefox Safe Mode doesn't start - Profile Manager doesn't work - Opera has the same problem - Restarting my computer didn't work - Reinstalling didn't work - Restarting and Reinstalling didn't work - I don't have CCleaner so that's not an issue - I went into my OSDrive to hunt and delete every folder labelled Mozilla I could find and that didn't change anything on reinstallation - The link I used to download the installer is: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/

Any suggestions? I saw a forum post that suggested a faulty value somewhere in the Windows Registry (http://kb.mozillazine.org/Browser_will_not_start_up#No_Mozilla_applications_will_start), but the link it cites doesn't work anymore and I would prefer not to go Registry diving if I don't have to. Thanks and let me know if you need anything else.
creator: collin.poag

title: Firefox often jums to a Search screen when I press Enter
content: I am totallly blind, using the JAWS screen reader, latest build, Windows 10, desktop PC. Often when I am on a website screen at a point where I am supposed to press Enter to click an item, pressing Enter or Spacebar (as a blind person would do to click an item) causes the Firefox screen to change to some kind of search screen that shows items such as Calculator, Ask Cortana, Voice Input, and other items that appear to be part of the Windows search system and not part of the website on which I was working. In order to get back to the website where I was working, I have to press Alt-Tab, then hunt for the item on which I originally wanted to click in order to continue to the next screen of the site where I had been working. This annoying problem has often happened on several different websites often enough to be quite annoying. It began with the update just before this last update, which installed a day or so ago. So the problem began on installation of the version just before the most current one. I suspect that there is now a problem on how JAWS interacts with the last two "builds" or "versions" - whatever you folk call them. ,

title: Action pages of emails do not display (FF 86, 87 - March 2021)
content:
EMAIL DISPLAY IN GMAIL: Hello. All of my emails open the first page okay, but an increasing number of action pages in emails do not open. Those pages contain forms to fill out, petitions to sign, and donations to make. This problem began in late February/early March (FF 86&87).

The tech support at EveryAction.com said she thought they need Javascript to open, but I couldn't find any setting or add-on in FF to enable/disable Javascript. I don't know why all of their action pages have been opening fine for years--maybe it's related to FF's new versions. I tried adding Policy Control because it supposedly enables/disables Javascript but it didn't solve my problem.

The tech support at Earth Justice wrote this in response to my report about their action pages not displaying: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:87.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/87.0; https://earthjustice.org/action/investigate-troubling-payments-that-threaten-the-florida-panther?contactdata=8D8RgJTCUXwiDCjeWPHh7wQ1fwDy7YSqjRoUFBMLj9iH2tXUofJiQ1CKU%2fIhkHfdjY8KsFkiYme4BhD4yp%2bpJ9S13ALo6NdUs4CtwLA2KaAhIZ0GP2%2bWq9ZUYNwtkHNEKC%2bxUF4VNRJ1XirXG00WayYuwLGnnHVzRWtCwf3s%2fqtR64TlcMwKx0w2e3AyPLspJ8xDw1TQNs%2fSBpWztf%2fNBkvDKFTrC6fsKAvY54zt13IfVVPcfU%2byEdneTMzDaYIN&ms=email&utm_source=crm&utm_medium=email&utm_term=action&utm_campaign=2102_Action_Panthers_Haaland&%3butm_content=HTMLTakeActionButton1&emci=5a0f473e-c881-eb11-85aa-00155d43c992&emdi=01870d6d-d68b-eb11-85aa-00155d43c992&ceid=962627 "We are still investigating this problem, but it appears to be concentrated among Firefox users. We do know that our EveryAction forms require Javascript to be enabled, so if it’s disabled and you’re able to enable it that might work and would be helpful to our efforts to sort this out. Let us know if you’re able to get that to work, and thank you for your patience." Thanks, Kyle Berquist (he/him) Digital Advocacy Associate 50 California Street, Suite 500 San Francisco, CA 94111 T: 206.434.6455 F: 415.217.2040 earthjustice.org

I would be very grateful for your help in solving this problem. I'm sure there are other users out there with same problem. Thank you. --Sincerely, Bo Bergstrom.
creator: bo.cinesthetic.30.yx

title: dark mode
content:
I'm trying to give Firefox an honest shot, coming from Safari on a Mac.

My system is set to dark mode and generally everything works as it should. Darkness everywhere, which is good.

In Firefox I have set the theme to dark but the folders in my bookmark bar are light with darkish text. Also the "Save page as..." dialog is light background with dark text.

What I need is white text on a dark background.

Is this possible or should I move on to another browser?

thanks in advance
creator: temp12

title: Firefox must be support for Windows XP and Vista
content:
Dear admin

∵ 1.Firefox System Requirements

Firefox Recommended Hardware 

   Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2    512MB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version    200MB of hard drive space

https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/87.0/system-requirements/ https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/87.0/releasenotes/ https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/browsers/


Recommended Hardware 

   Pentium 4    512MB of RAM    200MB of hard drive space

support for Windows XP and Vista


∵ 2.Portability

How well does your browser work across your devices? Portability Firefox https://www.mozilla.org/media/protocol/img/logos/firefox/browser/logo.eb1324e44442.svg OS availability https://www.mozilla.org/media/img/firefox/compare/icon-check.f5e1f7b288ca.svg

Firefox OS availability = yes?

https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/browsers/compare/



∴ 1."Firefox has ended support for Windows XP and Vista" is wrong!!!

"https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/end-support-windows-xp-and-vista" is wrong!!!

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/search?q=firefox-windows-xp-vista


∴ 2.Firefox System Requirements

Firefox Windows Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit) 

   Windows xp    Windows vista    Windows 7    Windows 8    Windows 10

Firefox must be support for Windows XP and Vista


∴ or 3.Portability

How well does your browser work across your devices? Portability Firefox https://www.mozilla.org/media/protocol/img/logos/firefox/browser/logo.eb1324e44442.svg OS availability https://www.mozilla.org/media/img/firefox/compare/icon-dash.ef660bd874fc.svg

Firefox OS availability = No

change yes => no

https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/browsers/compare/

title: A print preview
content: A print preview is displayed when printing is executed, and a print dialog is displayed when the print button is clicked. Not long ago, the print preview did not appear. Are there any settings or tools that do not display the print preview?

Can you please provide guidance on how to resolve this problem. Regards Martin Birch
